{"id":1141064816,"question_id":3239,"lang":"java","lang_name":"Java","time":"5Â months","timestamp":1704772946,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"19 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1141064816/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Minimum Number of Operations to Make X and Y Equal","memory":"44.8 MB","code":"class Solution {\n    public int minimumOperationsToMakeEqual(int x, int y) {\n        Queue<Integer> queue = new LinkedList<>();\n        Set<Integer> visited = new HashSet<>();\n        queue.offer(x);\n        int ans = 0;\n\n        while (!queue.isEmpty()) {\n            int size = queue.size();\n            for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {\n                int curr = queue.poll();\n\n                if (curr == y) {\n                    return ans;\n                }\n\n                if (visited.contains(curr)) {\n                    continue;\n                }\n                visited.add(curr);\n\n                queue.offer(curr + 1);\n                if (curr > 1) {\n                    queue.offer(curr - 1);\n                }\n\n                if (curr % 11 == 0) {\n                    queue.offer(curr / 11);\n                }\n                if (curr % 5 == 0) {\n                    queue.offer(curr / 5);\n                }\n            }\n            ans++;\n        }\n\n        return -1;\n    }\n}","compare_result":"","title_slug":"minimum-number-of-operations-to-make-x-and-y-equal","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
